section.title: Present Continuous as future
section.sectiontitle: Use the Present Continuous tense to talk about plans and arrangements in the future.
section.text1a: We're meeting Sonia at the station at six o'clock.
section.text2a: John isn't starting his university course in October.
section.sectiontitle2: Use the Present Continuous as future when the plans and arrangements are certain, e.g. when you have bought tickets or made arrangements with a friend or organised something or made a strong decision.
section.text3: She bought her plane ticket yesterday.
section.text3a: She's flying to San Francisco next week.
section.text4: We made arrangements for dinner tonight.
section.text4a: We're meeting at White's Bar.
